ai-tha-ap423:1.3_0: Seeing him, he stepped on the foot.
ai-tha-ap423:2.2_0: he swept away the Bodhi Tree.
ai-tha-ap423:2.4_0: dropped (him) from the time I worshiped him.
ai-tha-ap423:3.1_0: filling my mind with confidence in him,
ai-tha-ap423:3.2_0: Having raised my joined palms to him,
ai-tha-ap423:4.1_0: I shall go along the path
ai-tha-ap423:5.2_0: let us enjoy my fruit, Todeyya.
ai-tha-ap423:5.4_0: I delight in the heavenly realm.

ai-tha-ap423:8.3_0: his mind upright and not wavering,
ai-tha-ap423:9.4_0: is my killing, and my grief (from him),
ai-tha-ap423:11.3_0: I’m not aware of any living being
ai-tha-ap423:12.2_0: rebirth into all states of existence is eradicated,
ai-tha-ap423:13.1_0: It was so welcome for me
ai-tha-ap423:13.2_0: to be in the presence of the Buddha.
ai-tha-ap423:14.3_0: I’ve realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
ai-tha-ap423:15.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Saviṭṭha.
